title: The Faithful Few
shortSummary: Psalm 12 is a heartfelt plea from David for God’s help amid a time when godly and faithful people are disappearing. It contrasts the deceitful speech of the wicked with the pure and trustworthy words of the Lord, affirming God’s protection over His people.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The psalmist and king of Israel who laments the decline of godliness and calls on the Lord for help.

keyCharacters.name: The godly man
keyCharacters.description: Represents the faithful and righteous individuals who are fading away from among mankind.

keyCharacters.name: The wicked
keyCharacters.description: Those who speak deceitfully and arrogantly, opposing godliness and oppressing the poor.

definitions.definition: A musical term possibly indicating the eighth tone or a specific style of music used in worship.
Empty, worthless, or false speech; lacking truth or substance.
Speech that is deceitful and insincere, often used to manipulate or deceive others.
Words that are morally and spiritually clean, trustworthy, and refined, like silver purified by fire.

outline.heading: Cry for Help Amid Declining Faithfulness
outline.description: David laments the disappearance of godly and faithful people and describes the deceitful, flattering speech prevalent among men.

outline.heading: Judgment on Deceitful Speech
outline.description: The psalmist declares that the Lord will cut off proud and flattering lips who arrogantly claim independence from God.

outline.heading: God’s Promise to Protect the Oppressed
outline.description: God responds to the cries of the needy and promises to arise and protect them from their oppressors.

outline.heading: The Purity and Preservation of God’s Word
outline.description: David affirms the purity and trustworthiness of God’s words, which God Himself will preserve forever.

outline.heading: The Prevalence of Wickedness
outline.description: The psalm concludes by acknowledging the widespread presence of wickedness and the exaltation of vile men.

application: Trust in the purity and faithfulness of God’s Word as a firm foundation amid a corrupt world.
Pray earnestly for God’s protection over the vulnerable and oppressed in times of injustice.
Guard your speech against deceit and flattery, striving to speak truthfully and humbly before God and others.
Remain faithful even when godliness seems to be fading around you, relying on God’s sustaining power.

keyVerses.text: Help, LORD; for the godly man ceaseth; for the faithful fail from among the children of men.
keyVerses.significance: This verse captures the psalmist’s urgent plea for divine help as godliness declines.

keyVerses.text: The words of the LORD are pure words: as silver tried in a furnace of earth, purified seven times.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the absolute purity and reliability of God’s promises and truth.

keyVerses.text: For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, saith the LORD; I will set him in safety from him that puffeth at him.
keyVerses.significance: This verse assures believers that God hears the cries of the oppressed and will act to protect them.
